title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks snapped a three-day losing streak as the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq gained 1.3%, 1.2% and 0.7%, respectively.

---

Walt Disney said its Disney+ streaming service added fewer users than Wall Street had expected, after months of torrid growth.

---

Some big U.S. banks will participate in an initiative aimed at making it easier for people who have traditionally lacked borrowing opportunities to get credit cards.

---

Coinbase Global's profit surged in the first quarter, driven by a rally in bitcoin and other digital assets.

---

Canadian National took the lead in the race to acquire Kansas City Southern , which declared its roughly $30 billion takeover bid superior to a rival proposal.

---

Alibaba posted its first-ever quarterly loss since it went public after being hit by a record antitrust fine in China.

---

DoorDash 's revenue tripled in the first quarter, showing sustained demand for food-delivery services.

---

Boeing received approval from U.S. regulators for fixes to an electrical problem that has grounded more than 100 of its 737 MAX jets.

---

Airbnb reported more than $10 billion in bookings for the home-sharing company's latest quarter.
